result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lauren K. Sayre is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
------------------------------------
Pay Drug Court program fee in the amount of $500.00.

IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015, that upon successful completion of the Walworth County Drug Court Program AND WITH NO VIOLATIONS OF THE RULES OF PROGRAM, the Clerk of Court shall issue an order expunging the record.
------------------------------------

The defendant is a participant of the Walworth County Drug Court program and must comply with all the rules and regulations of the program with no violations.
------------------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
------------------------------------

timeConds.notes:
As a condition of probation, the defendant must serve five (5) days in the Walworth County Jail without Work Release to commence immediately after sentencing. The Court STAYS one year of the conditional jail time to be used at the Court's discretion.
--------------------------------------
*AMENDMENT - 10/26/2016 - Pursuant to Memo from DOC, conditional jail time is amended to one (1) year. 
**As a condition of probation, the defendant must serve five (5) days in the Walworth County Jail WITHOUT work release commencing forthwith (09/16/2016). The Court STAYS the balance of the conditional jail time for use at the Court's discretion.

AMENDMENT 5/17/2016: DEFENDANT MAY HAVE CONTACT WITH HER DAUGHTER AT THE DISCRETION OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES.  
06/02/2016 NOTE:  As of this date, the defendant has NOT YET SIGNED the Amended Bail Bond (df)

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Any prescribed medication is to be taken within the terms / limits of the prescription.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH NATHANAEL GREEN OR HIS RESIDENCE. NO CONTACT WITH ANY MINORS UNLESS DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES NOTIFIES THE COURT THAT THERE CAN BE CONTACT WITH HER CHILD.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
